block.p: Two new guides showcase contributions of African-Americans to the history and culture of North Carolina and Florida.

One, ''The Rich Heritage of African Americans in North Carolina,'' offers a brief history, a guide to historic and cultural sites, a sampling of cultural events throughout the state, and profiles of African-American musicians and artists. The historical section starts with the introduction of slaves in the 16th century and covers events through the Civil Rights movements of the 1950's and 1960's. A directory of historic and cultural places includes museums, churches, markets, hospitals and schools. Festivals and other annual events are catalogued by location. The 52-page guide is free from the North Carolina Division of Tourism, (800) 847-4862, or can be read at www.visitnc.com.
Two new guides showcase contributions of African-Americans to the history and culture of North Carolina and Florida.

One, ''The Rich Heritage of African Americans in North Carolina,'' offers a brief history, a guide to historic and cultural sites, a sampling of cultural events throughout the state, and profiles of African-American musicians and artists. The historical section starts with the introduction of slaves in the 16th century and covers events through the Civil Rights movements of the 1950's and 1960's. A directory of historic and cultural places includes museums, churches, markets, hospitals and schools. Festivals and other annual events are catalogued by location. The 52-page guide is free from the North Carolina Division of Tourism, (800) 847-4862, or can be read at www.visitnc.com.

''Florida Black Heritage Trail'' is a 32-page glossy book with descriptions of more than 140 historical places and profiles of civil rights activists, educators, musicians and other black Floridians. A schedule of annual festivals and three self-guided driving tours are included.

An Internet version is available at www.flheritage.com/magazine/bht. The printed version costs $3.95 plus tax and shipping, from Florida History Associates, 500 South Bronough Street, Tallahassee, Fla. 32399; (850) 488-1484.
